slides.title: Basic Formula
slides.content:
**Fundamental Relationship:**

**Distance = Speed × Time**

**Speed = Distance / Time**

**Time = Distance / Speed**

**Units:** km/hr, m/s, etc.

slides.title: Unit Conversion
slides.content:
**Converting km/hr to m/s:**

Multiply by 5/18

**Example:** 36 km/hr = 36 × 5/18 = 10 m/s

**Converting m/s to km/hr:**

Multiply by 18/5

**Example:** 10 m/s = 10 × 18/5 = 36 km/hr

slides.title: Average Speed
slides.content:
**When distances are equal:**

Average Speed = (2 × S1 × S2) / (S1 + S2)

**When times are equal:**

Average Speed = (S1 + S2) / 2

**General Formula:**

Average Speed = Total Distance / Total Time

slides.title: Relative Speed
slides.content:
**Same Direction:**

Relative Speed = S1 - S2

**Opposite Direction:**

Relative Speed = S1 + S2

**Example:** Train A at 60 km/hr, Train B at 40 km/hr
- Same direction: 60-40 = 20 km/hr
- Opposite: 60+40 = 100 km/hr

slides.title: Train Problems
slides.content:
**Time to cross a pole/person:**

Time = Length of train / Speed

**Time to cross a platform/bridge:**

Time = (Length of train + Length of platform) / Speed
